properties.name: Cover
properties.description: [-] to ranged attacks targeting someone hiding behind it.

biotechsarcophagus.name: Biotech Sarcophagus
biotechsarcophagus.description: Layers upon layers of chitin shards interlaced with glowing capillaries, intricately carved with symbols and figures. It shifts and buzzes restlessly, as though dreaming.

options.name: First success
options.description: The symbols and figures seem to depict insectoid figures perfoming great deeds. There are also symbols meant to grant safe passage to the afterlife, as well as symbols of renewal and rebirth.

options.name: Second success
options.description: Spectroscopic techniques reveal the silhouette of an insectoid figure resting within. It shifts restlessly in a state between life and death.

options.name: Third success
options.description: The glyphs inscribed upon the sarcophagus speak of an inevitable doom machine that awaits at the end of all things, and deathless warrior-wizards sent forward in time to wage war against its influence.

options.name: Body swap
options.description: Extremely difficult THO test at [-]. On success: swap bodies with the *creatures.mantidbiolich*.

options.name: Pheromonal peace protocols
options.description: Difficult THO test. On success: the *creatures.mantidbiolich* becomes nonhostile.

options.name: Stealth open
options.description: Medium THO test. On success: the biosarcophagus opens without waking the *creatures.mantidbiolich*, though it is a light sleeper...

druidicbasrelief.name: Druidic bas-relief
druidicbasrelief.description: Shows insectile figures fighting technological horrors descending from the sky.

options.name: First success
options.description: Long ago, strange men in flying ships came to this world, bringing the sable oil that devours all things. The insectile tribes of this world, skilled in the ways of living things, fought back. They matched their metal priests spell for spell. They bred great sea monsters that tore their ships from the heavens and smote their ruin upon the earth.

options.name: Second success
options.description: But it was not enough. Behind it all, the sable oil continued to sicken and devour the life of this world, and the power of the shamans waned. In a last desperate act, they sacrificed their lives in a great spell that replaced the soul within the sable oil with theirs.

options.name: Third success
options.description: Now the great shamans forever sleep. Should this world be threatened again, the oil will gather, the great beasts will rise, and the shamans will awaken from their slumber to do battle once more.

ecowards.name: Eco-Wards
ecowards.description: Green glowing sigils crawl across the ground and emit ghostly aurora-lights that fill the room.

options.name: First success
options.description: These appear to be biomagical wards set up to deter intrusion.

options.name: Second success
options.description: The sigils themselves seem to be made out of bacteria that feed off of and emit thaumokinetic energy.

options.name: Third success
options.description: The bacteria contains genomes that predispose it to symbiosis with humanoid creatures.

options.name: Solve the bioencryption
options.description: Extremely difficult THO test.

options.name: Distract the bacteria
options.description: Offer a magical item or 1d20 life and the bacteria will attempt to consume it rather than doing their assigned duty.

options.name: Step through
options.description: The wards flicker and disappear. A rumbling begins in the distance. A swarm of *creatures.lithoformnematodes* will arrive in 1 turn.

options.name: Take a sample
options.description: Easy AGI test + medium THO test: gain a sample of *items.arcanophagebacteria*.

humanoidstatues.name: Humanoid Statues
humanoidstatues.description: Made of concrete-like material, frozen in unnerving poses.

options.name: First success
options.description: They are all in poses of fear and disgust.

options.name: Second success
options.description: They were not crafted by sentient hands.

options.name: Chip slightly
options.description: Traces of organic material lie within.

options.name: Crack open
options.description: Mummified human flesh and bones inside. Each statue cracked open has a 1-in-6 chance of having a random piece of explorer's gear.

microbiomebubble.name: Microbiome Bubble
microbiomebubble.flavor: A small gelatinous sphere floats in the waves. Tiny plants and creatures swirl within.
microbiomebubble.description: A tiny ecosystem contained in a gelatinous, self-sustaining bubble.

options.name: First success
options.description: This ecosystem looks completely self-sustaining and shut out from the outside world.

options.name: Second success
options.description: Adding substances foreign to the microbiome could damage its delicate internal ecobalance.

options.name: Third success
options.description: The microbiome interior experiences a rapid flurry of genetic activity, due to a high quantity of stem cells.

options.name: Add some Supplies
options.description: -1d3 supply. The biome grows: [+] to all tests regarding the microbiome bubble, but its interior systems are disrupted. Doing this a second time destroys the bubble.

options.name: Add some Blood
options.description: -1d6 life. Gain 3 knowledge. Bubble becomes a *creatures.roamingmicrobiome* and attacks.

options.name: Take a Sample
options.description: Easy AGI test: gain *items.rawstemcells*. On failure: +1 disruption.

options.name: Take it All
options.description: +1d3 disruption. Gain 2 *items.rawstemcells*. The microbiome is destroyed.

oilvein.name: Oil Vein
oilvein.description: A curious black oil seeps upward through the cracks between shoreline rocks.

options.name: First success
options.description: The oil moves on its own volition. It quests and probes, as though seeking something.

options.name: Second success
options.description: Microscopic inspection reveals unusually intelligent schooling and patterning activity at the molecular level, indicating that it is composed of nanites.

options.name: Third success
options.description: The nanites appear to devour iron and other metals at a rapid rate in order to reproduce and self-sustain.

options.name: Take a sample
options.description: Easy AGI test: gain *items.sableoil*. On failure: +1 disruption.
